title: Grattis på födelsedagen Peter!
content: Wishing a very happy birthday to the friendliest [father, type buddy and owner](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111221045/http:/www.fountain.nu/designers/peterbruhn.asp) of the friendliest [digital type foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111221045/http:/www.fountain.nu/). Hope you had a good one Peter! :-)
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content:
[Peter är min typsnitt vän!](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111221045/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FT.118672.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=PETER+RULEZ&sampleSize=48)

Now that I’ve dropped my horrible Swedish like a turd in this otherwise wellwishing thread, allow me to continue in English: [Peter is my fonty friend!](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111221045/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FT.118672.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=38&sampleText=Peter+is+my+fonty+friend%21&sampleSize=38) A trip to his summer home in Malmö was the perfect end to my stint in Sweden. He has a lovely family and a lovely foundry. He is quick to help and slow to anger. He laughs at my jokes and listens to my music. I love this man.

Here’s the best to you, Petah! Looking forward to hearing you and Stefan speak at TypeCon. (You’ve become quite the lecturer in your old age.)

And now, [a song](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111221045/http:/stewf.com/stewftone/Happy%20Svensk%20Birthday.mp3).
Happy Birthday, Peter! See you soon.
